1.text: “Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

2.text: Five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

3.text: Those who were foolish took their lamps but brought no oil along with them,

4.text: whereas the wise ones brought oil in their vessels along with their lamps.

5.text: Now since the bridegroom was late, they all became tired and fell asleep.

6.text: But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’

7.text: Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.

8.text: The foolish virgins said to the wise ones, ‘Give us some of your oil because our lamps are going out.’

9.text: But the wise virgins answered: ‘What if there is not enough for us and you? But go rather to those who sell [oil] and buy some for yourselves.’

10.text: While they went away to buy [oil], the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast, and then the door was shut.

11.text: Afterwards, the other virgins also arrived and said: ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’

12.text: But he answered, ‘Amen, I tell you that I do not know you!’

13.text: Watch therefore, for you do not know the day or the hour  that the Son of Man is coming.

14.text: Indeed, the Kingdom is like a man who was leaving for another country. He called his own slaves and entrusted his goods to them.

15.text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. And immediately he went on a journey.

16.text: Then the one who received five talents went off, did business with them and earned another five talents.

17.text: And in the same way, the one who had received two gained another two.

18.text: But the slave who received one talent went off, dug [a hole] in the ground and hid his lord’s money.

19.text: After a long time, the lord of those slaves returned and settled accounts with them.

20.text: The one who had received the five talents came forward and brought another five talents, saying: ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five!’

21.text: The lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord!’

22.text: The one who had received the two talents also came forward and said, ‘Lord, you entrusted me with two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents!’

23.text: The lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord!’

24.text: The one who had received one talent now came forward and said, ‘Lord, I knew you, that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter.

25.text: I was afraid! I went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours!’

26.text: But his lord answered, ‘You wicked and lazy slave! You understood that I reap where I did not sow, and that I gather where I did not scatter.

27.text: And so, you should have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming, I would have received it back with interest.

28.text: Therefore, take away the talent from this one, and give it to the one who has the ten talents.

29.text: For to everyone who has, [more] will be given and he will have in abundance. But from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.

30.text: Throw out the unprofitable slave into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’”

31.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.

32.text: All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate them one from another, just as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

33.text: He will place the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

34.text: Then the King will tell those on his right hand, ‘Come, you blessed of my Father! Inherit the Kingdom prepared for you since the foundation of the world!

35.text: For I was hungry and you gave me food to eat; I was thirsty and you gave me drink; I was a stranger and you took me in.

36.text: I was naked and you clothed me; I was sick and you visited me; I was in prison, and you came to me.’

37.text: Then the righteous will answer him, saying: ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you; or thirsty and give you a drink?

38.text: When did we see you as a stranger and take you in; or naked, and clothe you?

39.text: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and visit you?’

40.text: The King will answer them, ‘Amen, I tell you: as much as you did it to one of the least of these my brethren, you did it to me.’

41.text: Then he will also say to those on his left hand, ‘Depart from me, you accursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels!

42.text: For I was hungry and you gave me no food; I was thirsty and you gave me no drink;

43.text: I was a stranger and you did not receive me; naked, and you did not clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you did not visit me.’

44.text: Then they will answer him: ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not help you?’

45.text: Then he will answer them, saying: ‘Amen, I tell you: as much as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to me.’

46.text: These [ones on the left] will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
